t: I*pn will sing of steadfast love and justice; to*ld you, O Lord,*s I will make music.
I*ln will ponder the way that is blameless. Oh*ld when will you come to me? I*ln will walk with integrity of heart within*ld my house;
I*ln will not set before my eyes anything*ld that is worthless. I*ln hate the work of those who fall away; it*ld shall not cling to me.
A*ln perverse heart shall be far from me; I*ld will know nothing of evil.
Whoever*pn slanders his neighbor secretly I*ld will destroy. Whoever*ln has a haughty look and an arrogant heart I*ld will not endure.
I*pn will look with favor on the faithful in the land, that*ld they may dwell with me; he*ln who walks in the way that is blameless shall*ld minister to me.
No*pn one who practices deceit shall*ld dwell in my house; no*ln one who utters lies shall*ld continue before my eyes.
Morning*pn by morning I will destroy all*ld the wicked in the land, cutting*ln off all the evildoers from*ld the city of the Lord.*s
